Package com.library.database.repositories

Class AuthorRepository

java.lang.Object
com.library.database.repositories.Repository<Author>
com.library.database.repositories.AuthorRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class AuthorRepository extends Repository<Author>
The AuthorRepository class provides specific repository operations for managing Author entities using Hibernate as the underlying ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) framework. It extends the generic Repository class and implements methods for finding authors by various criteria.

This class follows the Singleton design pattern to ensure a single instance is used across the application, promoting consistency in entity management.

Usage of this class includes finding authors by ID, retrieving all authors, getting authors by ID, finding authors by name, finding all authors with a specific name, and finding all authors from a particular country.

Note: This class is thread-safe due to the Singleton pattern, making it suitable for use in multi-threaded environments.

    • findById

      public Optional<Author> findById(Long id) throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Find and return an author by their unique identifier (ID). This method utilizes the Hibernate session to perform the database operation. If the author is not found, an empty Optional is returned.
      Specified by:
      findById in class Repository<Author>
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the author to find.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the found author, or empty if the author is not found.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.

    • findAll

      public List<Author> findAll() throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Retrieve and return a list of all authors. This method uses Hibernates HQL (Hibernate Query Language) to execute a query to fetch all authors.
      Specified by:
      findAll in class Repository<Author>
      Returns:
      A list containing all authors.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.

    • getById

      public Author getById(Long id)
      Get and return an author by their unique identifier (ID). This method is similar to findById(Long), but it returns the author directly instead of wrapping it in an Optional. If the author is not found, it returns null.
      Specified by:
      getById in class Repository<Author>
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the author to get.
      Returns:
      The found author, or null if the author is not found.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.

    • findByName

      public Optional<Author> findByName(String authorName) throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Find and return an author by their name. This method uses a parameterized query to search for an author with the specified name. If the author is not found, an empty Optional is returned.
      Parameters:
      authorName - The name of the author to find.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the found author, or empty if the author is not found.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.
